item.title: Hani add a quote by Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi
item.description: "Forget safety. Live where you fear to live. Destroy your reputation. Be notorious." -- Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi

item.title: Hani add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "Where there is ruin, there is hope for a treasure." -- Rumi

item.title: Hani add a quote by نصر حامد أبو زيد
item.description: "العلمانية ليست إلحاداً .. العلمانية تعني (فصل السلطة السياسية عن السلطة الدينية) وليس حتى فصل السياسة عن الدين" -- نصر حامد أبو زيد

item.title: Hani add a quote by نصر حامد أبو زيد
item.description: "إن الثقافة تعني تحول الكائن من مجرد الوجود الطبيعي إلى الوعي بهذا الوجود" -- نصر حامد أبو زيد

item.title: Hani add a quote by Karl Marx
item.description: "Men make their own history, but they do not make it as they please; they do not make it under self-selected circumstances, but under circumstances existing already, given and transmitted from the past. The tradition of all dead generations weighs like a nightmare on the brains of the living. And just as they seem to be occupied with revolutionizing themselves and things, creating something that did not exist before, precisely in such epochs of revolutionary crisis they anxiously conjure up the spirits of the past to their service, borrowing from them names, battle slogans, and costumes in order to present this new scene in world history in time-honored disguise and borrowed language." -- Karl Marx
